title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 2005.4 - Presiding officers
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 2005.4 - Presiding officers

State Regulations

The president or one or more persons designated and
empowered by the corporation to conduct hearings may be presiding officers. Such persons so designated and empowered may be independent contractors or
officers or employees of the corporation or governmental hearing officers. Whenever a presiding officer is disqualified or it becomes impractical for such
officer to continue the hearing, another presiding officer may be assigned to
continue with the case unless it is shown that substantial prejudice to the
party will result therefrom. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
2005.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
